overview:
Mr. Lawler joined Gatekeeper in 1998. He earned a B.S. in Business Administration with an emphasis in Accounting from California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo in 1980. He spent the next six years with Price Waterhouse, where he became a CPA and achieved the position of Tax Manager. In 1987, Mr. Lawler left Price Waterhouse to serve as Vice President of Finance for Wallace Moir Company, where he became the Chief Financial Officer. In 1989, he moved to Brinderson Real Estate Group, a commercial real estate developer.

In 1994, Mr. Lawler left Brinderson to become the Chief Financial Officer of Belgravia Capital Corporation. From 1998 through 2002, Mr. Lawler was an active partner with Belgravia Capital Partners, LLC, a company that invested in start up and emerging companies, including investing in Gatekeeper in 1998.

relationships.title: Chairman of the Board of Directors
